page.title: 06MALLYDAMS FAIRLIGHT E.SUSSEX
page.content:
The 60 acres of Mallydams Wood Nature Reserve, Fairlight, East Sussex was given to the RSPCA in l960 by Horace Quick, a retired teacher. It has been a nature reserve with a resident warden since l962.
In l974 the Field Centre was built to provide accommodation and equipment for visiting groups from schools and other organisations studying the wildlife. The Centre has two full time staff; John Goodman, the resident warden and Nigel Ford, the Education Officer.
Mallydams is open to the public one day a year, usually in September. There is an l8 point nature trail through part of the Reserve for visitors to follow. The Centre is very popular with children.
